info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Request successful. Resource with the specified name does not exist

200.description: Delete successful.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns an ApplicationGateway resource.

put.description: Creates or updates the specified application gateway.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update application gateway operation.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ApplicationGateway resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ApplicationGateway resource.

get.description: Lists all application gateways in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of ApplicationGateway resources.

get.description: Gets all the application gateways in a subscription.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of ApplicationGateway resources.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation starts the ApplicationGateway resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

post.description: Stops the specified application gateway in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation stops the ApplicationGateway resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

post.description: Gets the backend health of the specified application gateway in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands BackendAddressPool and BackendHttpSettings referenced in backend health.

200.description: Request successful.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

delete.description: Deletes the specified authorization from the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: Delete successful.

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

put.description: Creates or updates an authorization in the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: circuitName

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

parameters.name: authorizationParameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit authorization operation.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

get.description: Gets all authorizations in an express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the circuit.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resources.

address.description: IP address or FQDN of backend server.

ipConfiguration.description: Reference of IP configuration of backend server.

health.description: Health of backend server. Possible values are: 'Unknown', 'Up', 'Down', and 'Partial'.

name.description: Name of an application gateway SKU. Possible values are: 'Standard_Small', 'Standard_Medium', 'Standard_Large', 'WAF_Medium', and 'WAF_Large'.

tier.description: Tier of an application gateway. Possible values are: 'Standard' and 'WAF'.

capacity.description: Capacity (instance count) of an application gateway.

disabledSslProtocols.description: SSL protocols to be disabled on application gateway. Possible values are: 'TLSv1_0', 'TLSv1_1', and 'TLSv1_2'.

subnet.description: Reference of the subnet resource. A subnet from where application gateway gets its private address.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the application gateway subnet resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

ApplicationGatewayIPConfigurationPropert.description: Properties of IP configuration of an application gateway.

name.description: Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

ApplicationGatewayIPConfiguration.description: IP configuration of an application gateway. Currently 1 public and 1 private IP configuration is allowed.

cookieBasedAffinity.description: Cookie based affinity. Possible values are: 'Enabled' and 'Disabled'.

requestTimeout.description: Request timeout in seconds. Application Gateway will fail the request if response is not received within RequestTimeout. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

probe.description: Probe resource of an application gateway.

requireServerNameIndication.description: Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the HTTP listener resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

name.description: Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

ApplicationGatewayPathRule.description: Path rule of URL path map of an application gateway.

host.description: Host name to send the probe to.

path.description: Relative path of probe. Valid path starts from '/'. Probe is sent to <Protocol>://<host>:<port><path>

interval.description: The probing interval in seconds. This is the time interval between two consecutive probes. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

timeout.description: the probe timeout in seconds. Probe marked as failed if valid response is not received with this timeout period. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: The probe retry count. Backend server is marked down after consecutive probe failure count reaches UnhealthyThreshold. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 20.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the backend http settings resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

status.description: Status of the Azure async operation. Possible values are: 'InProgress', 'Succeeded', and 'Failed'.

AzureAsyncOperationResult.description: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is in progress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request and error information regarding the failure.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
